dictionary.name: help
dictionary.desc: get a list of commands, or use with a specific command to learn its use and synonyms (ie 'HELP LOOK')

dictionary.name: clear
dictionary.desc: clear previous commands

dictionary.name: look
dictionary.desc: examine surroundings, or examine a particular object (ie 'LOOK LANTERN')

dictionary.name: take
dictionary.desc: put an item in your inventory

dictionary.name: drop
dictionary.desc: remove an item from your inventory and put it in the current room

dictionary.name: inventory
dictionary.desc: list everything you have picked up

dictionary.name: use
dictionary.desc: make use of or give away an item; how this is done is based on context

dictionary.name: go
dictionary.desc: use with a direction or location to travel there (ie 'GO WEST'); you can also do this by entering the direction (ie 'WEST') or sometimes just the first letter (ie 'W')

dictionary.name: save
dictionary.desc: CURRENTLY NONFUNCTIONAL. save your progress under your name, using browser cookies

dictionary.name: load
dictionary.desc: CURRENTLY NONFUNCTIONAL. load the progress under a given name, using browser cookies

dictionary.name: talk
dictionary.desc: use with an intelligent character to hear what they have to say (ie 'TALK TO THE GUARD' or just 'TALK GUARD')

dictionary.name: sit
dictionary.desc: sit upon a sittable object

dictionary.name: all
dictionary.desc: all of the objects, items, and characters in the given area

dictionary.name: north
dictionary.desc: the direction of the arctic pole

dictionary.name: south
dictionary.desc: the direction towards the antarctic pole

dictionary.name: east
dictionary.desc: the direction towards the rising sun

dictionary.name: west
dictionary.desc: the direction towards the setting sun

dictionary.name: up
dictionary.desc: the direction towards the midday sun

dictionary.name: down
dictionary.desc: the direction towards the midnight sun

dictionary.name: out
dictionary.desc: the direction of the not inside

dictionary.name: in
dictionary.desc: the direction of the not outside

dictionary.name: cottage
dictionary.desc: dusty and dilapidated, but nonetheless you call it home

exit.desc: an old wooden door through which sunlight leaks faintly

dictionary.name: garden path
dictionary.desc: a lush garden path outside your cottage

exit.desc: a worn dirt path up the hill
a worn dirt path down to the fishing pond
an old, nostalgic wooden door

dictionary.name: pondside
dictionary.desc: a stony beach, with a short, dilapidated dock and some broken-down wooden chairs and crates

exit.desc: a worn dirt path back home

dictionary.name: winding path
dictionary.desc: you come to the base of a tall, looming tree; it looks climbable

exit.desc: a worn dirt path back home
an untamed road to the castle

dictionary.name: drawbridge
dictionary.desc: you stand before the open drawbridge to a dilapidated castle; perhaps that which you are looking for is inside...

exit.desc: a tall, iron castle gate
an untamed road from the castle

dictionary.name: castle courtyard
dictionary.desc: a garden that has been unattended for some time and has overgrown

exit.desc: a pair of rusted double doors leading into the castle proper
a tall, iron castle gate
a set of stairs leading up the tallest tower
a set of stairs leading down the deepest dungeon

dictionary.name: dungeon stairs
dictionary.desc: dark stone stairs leading deep beneath the castle

exit.desc: stairs back up towards sunlight
stairs leading down to the depths

dictionary.name: dungeon
dictionary.desc: a foul place which has not seen light in some time

exit.desc: stairs back up towards sunlight

dictionary.name: tower stairs
dictionary.desc: stone stairs which ascend to the highest room in the castle

exit.desc: stairs up to a decorated door
stairs back down towards the courtyard

dictionary.name: princess' chamber
dictionary.desc: the [i11] stands before you in a sunlit room

exit.desc: stairs back down towards the courtyard

dictionary.name: great feasting hall
dictionary.desc: you come to a great hall lined with tables decorated with tattered tablecloths and dusty candles. Unwashed plates and molded food litters the unattended gallery

exit.desc: a shattered golden doorway through which a throne can be seen
a pair of rusted double doors leading out to the courtyard

dictionary.name: throneroom
dictionary.desc: carefully stepping over the remains of a once expensive doorway, you come to a grand sitting room which all centers around a golden throne

exit.desc: a shattered golden doorway through which a feasting hall can be seen

dictionary.name: metal lantern
dictionary.desc: an old black lantern made from cast iron

use.msg: light shines from the $i00 and the darkness is obliterated

dictionary.fail_msg: this area is well lit enough already, the $i00 reveals nothing

dictionary.name: frod
dictionary.desc: made from young wood and string and worn from age and use- it has helped you catch many a fish before, but it may not catch you many more

use.msg:
you drop the hook in the water, and after a time, you feel a tug! you reel in a $i03! but as you go to unhook the bugger, he gives a strong wiggle and your $i01 snaps! you manage to catch the fish in the end, but was it worth it?
you suspect so

dictionary.fail_msg: you cast the line, but seeing as there are no inhabited bodies of water in the vicinity, you shouldn't be surprised when nothing bites

dictionary.name: red rose
dictionary.desc: a single rose puts the rest to shame; dew glances off of its crimson petals- what a magnificent gift!

use.msg: "what a magnificent gift", says the $i11 as she takes the $i02 from your hand in between her teeth and proceeds to swallow... yikes

dictionary.fail_msg: you take a deep whiff of the $i02- still fresh

dictionary.name: fat salmon
dictionary.desc: a big red salmon; you personally wouldn't eat it raw, but someone less discerning might

use.msg: the $i05 quickly takes from you the $i03; he scampers to the edge of the area and chews on it greedily

dictionary.fail_msg: you test the $i03 with your teeth, but human teeth aren't capable of the kind of rip and tear these thick scales require

dictionary.name: mouse
dictionary.desc: although you cannot see any mice, there is the sound of distant paw-scampering
dictionary.fail_msg: the only way to move a hole is to move that which encompasses it, and that tree aint going nowhere

dictionary.name: mean troll
dictionary.desc:
a dangerous troll standing 12ft tall; it is preposterously strong and known for its special attack, the 40x CONSECUTIVE HUMAN SKULL CRUSH
violent engagement is ill advised
just your luck that it is currently between you and the castle interior...

dictionary.name: contented troll
dictionary.desc: it seems he was merely hungry after all...

dictionary.name: smelly cheese
dictionary.desc: this cheese reeks, and it is melted just enough to mold like clay, leaving your hands with a slight, cheesy film

use.msg: as you produce the cheese, a $i04 scurries out with blinding speed and takes the cheese from you; you stand in surprise for a moment, as the mice return the favor and throw out of their hole one $i08
the $i14 retracts, apparently frightened of the fumous fromage- he disappates, leaving only his crown

dictionary.fail_msg: you remove the cheese from your knapsack and instantly regret it- cheesesmell abounds

dictionary.name: shining key
dictionary.desc: a golden key, apparently polished out of respect- where might it lead?
dictionary.fail_msg: you insert the key into whatever you hoped to insert it, but whatever it was, it was not a $i15, so it does not unlock

dictionary.name: darkness
synonym: darkness making it impossible to go down
dictionary.desc: you can't descend the stairs like this

dictionary.name: golden crown
dictionary.desc: fit for a monarch

use.msg: you kneel before the $i11 as she places gently the $i10 upon your head- you are crowned

dictionary.fail_msg: to crown oneself would be overly conceited, would it not?

dictionary.name: her highness
dictionary.desc: a $i11 stands before you in a surprisingly well-kept dress
dialogue: "Only the crowned may sit upon the throne."
"My father had a very sensitive nose. He hated weird smells."
"If you see what remains of my father, take his crown. But he will not give it freely."
dictionary.fail_msg: she slaps you, saying "I am not that kind of woman!"

dictionary.name: candle
dictionary.desc: its greenish wax emits an odor that can only really be described as weird

use.msg: the $i14 retracts, apparently frightened of the simple act of lighting a candle- he disappates, leaving only his crown

dictionary.fail_msg: a weird odor pervades the area

dictionary.name: throne
dictionary.desc: while the metal has tarnished and the cushioning has been chewed away by rats, this throne manages to remain impressively expensive-looking

dictionary.name: ghost
dictionary.desc: a mortifying undead, whose golden crown shines in the darkness, and whose bony hand reaches towards you

dictionary.name: door
dictionary.desc: a sturdy wooden door; what could be behind it?
dictionary.fail_msg: "You'll never get in like that, go find a guard with a key!"

dictionary.name: pond
dictionary.desc: you can see plenty of fish jumping about
dictionary.fail_msg: you scoop water, but it flows between your fingers
